channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Buyers Snap Up Aging and Empty Office Buildings for Deep Discounts
item.description: Bargain hunters are getting deals of up to 70 percent, a sign of the pain in the commercial property market that could lead to large losses for banks and investors in real-estate-backed loans.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: U.N. Commission Accuses Both Israel and Palestinian Groups of War Crimes
item.description: A report provided the first detailed U.N. examination of the Oct. 7 attack on Israel and the subsequent conflict in Gaza.

item.title: Snap U.K. election sends crypto industry scrambling to court Labour allies
item.description: The crypto lobby has been preparing for a changing of the political guard.

item.title: The Most Courageous Thing That Joe Biden Can Do
item.description: Israel, Ukraine and American democracy are on the line.

item.title: A Palestinian Professor Spoke Out Against the Gaza War. Israel Detained Her.
item.description: The investigation of Prof. Nadera Shalhoub-Kevorkian of Hebrew University has prompted a debate inside Israel about the repression of free speech and academic freedoms since the war began.

item.title: Why Russia, China and Big Tech all use fake female online profiles to get clicks
item.description: The human brain remains surprisingly easy to hack thanks in part to age-old gender stereotypes that have migrated from the real world to the virtual.

item.title: New U.N. War Crimes Accusations, and the Fed’s Plan for Rates
item.description: Plus, a major split in the hot dog world.

item.title: Pope Francis Is Accused of Using a Homophobic Slur Again
item.description: Two prominent Italian news agencies said the pontiff used the term on Tuesday during a meeting with priests, after he was accused of uttering the same word last month while speaking with Italian bishops.

item.title: EV adoption has another problem
item.description: In late May, copper hit a record high of nearly $5.20 a pound.

item.title: A Palestinian Professor Spoke Out Against the Gaza War. Israel Detained Her.
item.description: The investigation of Prof. Nadera Shalhoub-Kevorkian of Hebrew University has prompted a debate inside Israel about the repression of free speech and academic freedoms since the war began.

item.title: Hezbollah Launches Rocket Barrage After Commander Is Killed in Israeli Strike
item.description: The Israeli military said that dozens of rockets had been launched at northern Israel, causing fires. Hezbollah said the strikes were in response to the commander’s killing.

item.title: Elizabeth Holmes watches from a Texas prison as appeal of her Theranos fraud conviction begins in federal court
item.description: The hearing held in the San Francisco appeals court came nearly 2 1/2 years after a jury convicted Holmes for orchestrating a blood-testing scam that became a parable about greed and hubris in Silicon Valley.

item.title: E.U. Hits Electric Vehicles From China With Higher Tariffs
item.description: Leaders in Brussels are trying to curb China’s dominance in the industry, but European automakers fear the taxes will drive up prices and lead to a trade war.

item.title: Ukraine Says It Shot Down Most of a Russian Missile and Drone Barrage
item.description: Drawing on replenished supplies, Ukraine used mostly Western-provided air defense systems to deter the overnight assault.

item.title: California fast-tracks bill to make marketplaces like eBay collect bank account and tax ID numbers from high-volume online sellers
item.description: The idea is that thieves will be less likely to resell stolen merchandise if authorities can track them down.
